subject: Greetings From Edhon  ,
body:
Greetings From Edhon  ,
I hereby express my unwavering patience in awaiting your prompt response to the aforementioned correspondence. 
Please confirm your availability to enable me to reach out through Phone or email .
Best Regards,
Edhon Bernasconi ( LL.B, LL.M, Ph.D) , 
Attorney at Law
Brandschenkestrasse 24CH-8027

subject: Re:  Greetings From Edhon  ,
body:
Hello Edhon Bernasconi,

It's a pleasure to receive your message. I'm always eager to engage in new conversations and learn more about different topics. However, I must apologize as I can't provide my contact details due to personal reasons.

Could you please share more information about the topic you'd like to discuss? I'm all ears and ready to understand better.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Allene

subject: Re: Greetings From Edhon ,
body:
Greetings and seasonal compliments,

I am Edhon Bernasconi, a legal representative specializing in resolution
and probate matters at a prominent law firm based in Switzerland.

I am reaching out to you following extensive efforts to locate the
surviving family of Late Eng. Arthur Allene, who unfortunately passed away
intestate (i.e., without a will) due to a ruptured blood vessel in London
nine years ago. There exists an unclaimed Capital Investment Net Profit
(CINP) amounting to US$ 12,950,777.00 with a reputable Investment Company
in the United Kingdom. Given that you share the same family name as the
deceased, I am seeking your involvement as the  legal beneficiary to
facilitate the claiming of this investment, including its accrued interests
and policy benefits. Your familial relation is not crucial; rather, your
consent to proceed with the claims process is what's essential.

The Securities and Investment Board (SIB) under the Financial Regulatory
Authority (FRA) will otherwise take possession of these unclaimed funds in
line with the Financial Services Act 1986, specifically addressing
investments and funds inactive for over ten years. We have only a few days
remaining to finalize the termination, claim, and subsequent possession of
these investment funds.

Once this portfolio is secured in your name and the funds are transferred
to your designated bank account through your preferred payment method, I
propose that 10% of the funds be allocated to charities of your choice,
with 45% each going to you and myself. The process will be conducted
legally through the competent court's jurisdiction, adhering to the
Inheritance Act Claims (Provision for Family and Dependents) Act 1975. This
title encompasses statutory provisions regarding inadequate provision
within a will or under the Intestacy Law. I have outlined the procedural
strategies and technicalities, ensuring completion within seven to fourteen
working days upon receipt of your consent.

Please do not hesitate to reach out should you require further details or
clarifications.

Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated. Wishing you a prosperous
2024.
Best Regards,

Edhon Bernasconi ( LL.B, LL.M)
Attorney at Law
Brandschenkestrasse 24
CH-8027 Zurich, Switzerlan

subject: Re: Greetings From Edhon ,
body:
Hello Edhon Bernasconi,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm sorry to hear about the passing of Eng. Arthur Allene, it must have been a shock for his family and friends.

I'm intrigued by your message, but I have a few questions if you don't mind. How did you find my contact information? And how are we sure that I am the right person with the same family name as the deceased?

Also, could you please explain more about this Capital Investment Net Profit (CINP)? What exactly is it and how was it accrued?

Lastly, what would be my responsibilities in this process? You mentioned that my consent is essential, but what does that entail?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Allene

subject: Re: Greetings From Edhon ,
body:
Dear Allen ,

I trust this correspondence finds you in good health and spirits. It is
with great satisfaction that I engage in dialogue with you concerning the
aforementioned claim. Permit me to elaborate further on the particulars of
the subject matter at hand.

Regrettably, Arthur passed away in London nine years ago due to a ruptured
blood vessel, leaving his estate without a will, thereby rendering it
intestate. To initiate the requisite legal proceedings, I shall arrange a
meeting with the appropriate court to present our case verbally. Following
the protocol outlined in the inheritance claim procedures of the United
Kingdom, I will then proceed to affirm an Affidavit of Claim, secure an
Indemnity Letter, Administrative Letter, and Non-Residence Participatory
Status Permit.

Once these essential documents are duly prepared, the court will undertake
a thorough review, subsequently issuing an acknowledgment confirming the
acceptance of our claim and the closure of the deceased's portfolio with
the investment company. Subsequently, copies of these court-issued
documents will be forwarded to the Treasury for tax clearance and approval,
facilitating the eventual release of the final funds to your designated
bank account.

The total value of the investment stands at $166,966,317, comprising the
deceased's Initial Capital Deposit (ICD). Additionally, we are asserting a
claim over the Capital Investment Net Profit (CINP) of US$12,950,777.00,
alongside 2% of the total Investor's Capital Deposit (ICP), amounting to
$3,339,326. This 2% will be disbursed to your account on an annual basis
for the ensuing decade. However, it is imperative to note that the
Investor's Initial Capital Deposit (IICD) of $166,966,317 can only be
claimed after a period of 90 days following the activation and subsequent
termination of the dormant portfolio, in adherence to the investment claims
procedures stipulated by the United Kingdom.

It is my pleasure to confirm your eligibility for this claim, and I express
gratitude for finally locating a family member after an exhaustive search.
In accordance with the regulations set forth by the Securities and
Investment Board (SIB) under the Financial Services Act 1986, the immediate
possession of any unclaimed investments exceeding a decade is mandated.
Consequently, unclaimed investments or funds are subject to approval by the
regulatory body for transfer to His Majesty's Revenue and Customs (HMRC).
We have a remaining window of 36 days to complete the termination, claim,
and possession of this investment; failure to do so will result in
forfeiture to the Treasury Authority.

Upon the successful acquisition of this portfolio and subsequent release of
funds to your designated bank account, it is proposed that 10% of the funds
be allocated to charity organizations of your choosing, with 45%
apportioned to you and the remaining 45% to myself. Rest assured, all
requisite documentation supporting this claim is readily available and
shall be furnished upon request throughout the process.

The strategies and technicalities of this transaction have been
meticulously planned, and I anticipate its completion within seven to
fourteen days following receipt of your assent. To initiate the procurement
of documents in your name as the claimant/beneficiary, I kindly request the
provision of the following information:

    Full Name:
    Address:
    Direct Mobile Number:
    Occupation:
    Age:
    Place of Birth:

Please be assured that this claim will be pursued through legal channels
via the court, and all actions will be conducted in strict compliance with
the provisions of the Inheritance Act Claims (Provision for Family and
Dependents) Act 1975. This legislation governs statutory provisions in
instances where there is inadequate provision in the will or under
intestacy law (i.e., when an individual passes away without a will).

I extend my gratitude for your commitment to maintaining confidentiality
regarding this transaction. Should you have any further inquiries or
concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out.

Yours sincerely,

Edhon Bernasconi (LL.B, LL.M, M.A)

subject: Re: Greetings From Edhon ,
body:
Dear Edhon,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must say, it's quite a lot to take in. I'm not very familiar with these legal procedures and terminologies, but I'm trying my best to understand.

If I understood correctly, Arthur passed away without leaving a will and his estate is now intestate. You're planning to present our case in court and secure several documents like an Affidavit of Claim, Indemnity Letter, etc., correct? 

I'm also curious about the total value of the investment that stands at... well, you didn't mention a specific amount. Could you clarify this for me?

You mentioned something about disbursement on an annual basis for the next decade. How does this work exactly? And what happens after the period of 365 days following the activation of the dormant portfolio?

Also, could you explain more about the allocation of funds? You mentioned some percentages but didn't specify which amounts they refer to.

Lastly, you mentioned that we have a remaining window of certain days to complete the claim. How many days are left exactly?

I apologize if my questions seem basic or naive. As I said earlier, I'm not very familiar with these matters.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Allene
